title: servanthood
comment: The state of being the servant of others, especially of God. Scripture stresses the privileges and responsibilities of being a servant of God and points to Jesus Christ as the model of servanthood.

children.title: servanthood, in society
children.comment: Servants and slaves were an important feature of everyday life in biblical times. The idea of servanthood is used both literally and metaphorically throughout Scripture.

primaryrefs.comment: The words ``servant'' and ``slave'' are the same in Hebrew, but according to OT law, an Israelite servant was to be accorded more rights than a foreign slave.

children.title: Citizens referred to as servants of the king
Kings as servants of other kings
Servant as a self-designated title of respect
servanthood, in life of believers
children.comment: Servanthood as an expression of subservience is an integral aspect of a person's relationship with God.

children.title: Servants of God in the OT
Servants of God in the NT
servanthood, and worship of God
children.comment: The biblical understanding of servanthood has its foundation in people serving God in worship. The terms for ``service'' and ``worship'' are often interchangeable.

children.title: Worship is a central aspect of serving God
Worship entails total obedience, not merely correct religious observances
Worship and service to God must be exclusive
The service of the Levites and the priesthood
Service in the Tent of Meeting
The promise of restored service in the new temple
The true service of Jesus Christ as high priest

primaryrefs.comment: Hebrews sees the OT priesthood and its services as superseded by Jesus Christ.

children.title: The Christian's life as an act of worship
